Vote - AcceptText - The BL correction to line 10 is well worth keeping in the text, as there is not enough space for -δως. Also, χ instead of κ is unobjectionable and the sense is fine. The proposed correction to 16 is also defensible. Reading τῶν instead of what the editors suggest is an "'Ionische" form für γοῦν" accords with common sense and gives a perfectly fine meaning: "And of those from the (epoikion) of Demetrios, brother Neilos . . . together with your brother Okeanios...".

Vote - AcceptText - Comment from 2019: " Also in lin9 <:νῦν=BL 9.68|ed|τοῦτο:>. (Two other suggestions recorded in BL IX 68 are too uncertain.)" Keep the correction to lin10 but either don't mention those to lines 10 and 16 or mention them only in the apparatus.
Submit - BL corrections and one regularization.
Commit - Integrated BL 9 corrections for l. 9, 10, 16 and regularized the name Νεαρχείδῃ in l. 1
Finalized - Ready.
Vote - AcceptText - I agree with the change and with the PN attribution proposed by Gonis. The alternative with changed punctuation can be noted in the commentary, but it's not necessary.

Vote - AcceptText - This could be recorded as PN correction, i.e. <:<:ἀμελήσας|reg|ἠμελησας:>PN N. Litinas|ed|ἠμέλησας:>, preferably as an alternative to ed.’s ἠμέλησας: the language is emotive, and this could be an asyndetic construction, but in that case we have to punctuate after ἄλλους. || Also in lin9 <:νῦν=BL 9.68|ed|τοῦτο:>. (Two other suggestions recorded in BL IX 68 are too uncertain.)
Submit - l. 9 <:ἀμελήσας|reg|ἠμέλησας:> The reading is certain, but one should regularize ἠμέλησας to the participle ἀμελήσας. If we keep the indicative, the syntax is problematic.
